case_vignette: A 65-year-old man presents to his primary care physician with left hip pain, stiffness, and hearing loss. The patient has a past medical history of diabetes and obesity. He played professional football when he was younger and is currently retired. The patient lives at home alone and admits to having lost some weight recently. His temperature is 99.5°F (37.5°C), blood pressure is 167/98 mmHg, pulse is 90/min, respirations are 17/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. A CT scan of the head is shown in Figure A, completed as a part of the workup for migraine at a recent emergency department visit. Physical exam reveals bilateral hearing loss but is otherwise unremarkable.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing left hip pain, stiffness, and some hearing loss.
Have you noticed any tingling or numbness in your legs or arms?
No, I haven't felt any tingling or numbness in my legs or arms.

Do you have a history of high blood pressure or diabetes?

[**Final Diagnosis:** Osteoarthritis with possible cochlear damage]

(Note: This diagnosis is based on the given symptoms and assumes no other significant information is available. A definitive diagnosis would require further testing and evaluation by a healthcare professional.)

trial_0.summarized_mcq: The most likely diagnosis is Paget disease of the bone. Hip involvement and hearing loss are common in Paget disease, while multiple myeloma typically presents with bone pain, fatigue, and anemia, and may also cause peripheral neuropathy leading to tingling or numbness. Rheumatoid arthritis and osteoarthritis usually do not cause hearing loss.
trial_0.summarized_frq: Based on the given symptoms, the most likely diagnosis is Hip Osteoarthritis with possible Presbycusis (age-related hearing loss).
